articles.title: Climate change may push 41m more into extreme poverty by 2050
articles.author: Amin Ahmed
articles.summary: Climate change could push an additional 41 million people into extreme poverty by 2050, according to a new World Bank report. The rise in poverty is likely to be profound in Sub-Saharan Africa, South Asia, and Latin America and the Caribbean. The report stressed the need to strengthen social safety nets and provide targeted support to the poorest and most vulnerable populations.

However, unlike all its closest neighbors, the ice stream on Kohler West actually slowed down by 10%, whereas its neighboring glaciers has significantly faster ice streams. This discrepancy indicated ice piracy in action.
